ThingDef.label: Steel fibres
ThingDef.description: Steel fibres, either produced by phytomining or stripped from steel. Their creation process makes them weakly magnetic which binds them into bunches just large enough to be handled... delicately. Can be smelted into steel or processed into other products.

ThingDef.label: Steel yarn
ThingDef.description: Faux textile formed from steel fibres spun to create a metallic yarn. Can be used as a fabric to make clothing at the expense of weight and lack of insulation.\n\nNot recommended for human colonists as the scratchy texture is sure to infuriate anyone without masochistic tendencies. Androids will not be affected.

ThingDef.label: Plasteel fibres
ThingDef.description: Plasteel fibres, either produced by advanced phytomining or stripped from plasteel. Their creation process makes them weakly magnetic which binds them into bunches just large enough to be handled... delicately. Can be smelted into plasteel or processed into other products.

ThingDef.label: Plasteel matt
ThingDef.description: A metallic analogue of matted fur, which is then scraped and treated in a process similar to tanning leather. This faux leather formed from plasteel fibres can be used as a substitute for leather in any normal leather product. Requires significantly more work to use for crafting in this way.\n\nThe unique structure and pseudo-bonds formed by the fibres of this material make it astonishingly resistant to sudden blunt force deformation, while remaining supple and flexible in the range of low-energy states associated with normal movement.
